channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7802] Hadoop scripts unconditionally source "$bin"/../libexec/hadoop-config.sh.
item.description: It would be nice to be able to specify some other location for hadoop-config.sh

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This patch was tested on a local installation

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12502252/HADOOP-7802.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 7 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/356//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/356//artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/356//console

This message is automatically generated.
I noticed the same issue in hdfs script. So I am updating the patch with the same fix for hdfs
Please find attached the patch fixing this issue for hadoop and hdfs commands

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12502565/HADOOP-7802-2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/358//console

This message is automatically generated.
I noticed a lot more files suffer from this issue. Here is a patch to fix all the ones from common project
See for hdfs: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-2544
See for mapreduce: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MAPREDUCE-3373

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12502849/HADOOP-7802-3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 7 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/366//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/366//artifact/trunk/hadoop-common-project/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-common.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/366//console

This message is automatically generated.
ping

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Here is a patch to enable this behavior
